snippet: The vaginal gel worked even three hours after exposure, which would be particularly useful for women affected by domestic violence and rape.
abstract: Study published in the journal Science Translational Medicine finds that monkeys can be protected against HIV infection with a vaginal gel, even when it is used as long as three hours after sex; findings are another promising development in AIDS prevention.
lead_paragraph: The vaginal gel worked even three hours after exposure, which would be particularly useful for women affected by domestic violence and rape.

headline.main: Gel Protects Monkeys From H.I.V. After Sex, Study Finds
headline.print_headline: Gel Is Found to Protect Monkeys From H.I.V.

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations
